Articles.Content: What format are the KSP part model files? (.mu file extension) I heard people use Blender for part models in KSP, but there doesn't seem to be such a format in Blender's export file menu (I'm new to Blender, maybe I missed something?)...

This belongs in

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/forum/15-modelling-and-texturing-discussion/

 

But .mu files are a proprietary format written by one of the devs of KSP.
You can create your models in any modelling tool.
You then need to import them into Unity and use the KSP PartTools toolkit to export the .mu files from Unity.

There is also a python plugin that another dev wrote that you can add to Blender (but it can't do the shaders).

Edit: You can use that blender plugin (with it's limitations) or export from Blender in fbx format. and import it into a Unity project to complete the part setup followed by a PartTools export from Unity.

Edited October 31, 2016 by JPLRepo
Moved over to Modelling & Texturing Discussion.
